title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CLEVELAND – On a night where the hardwood floor of Gund Arena felt more like a canvas, Danny Ferry painted his masterpiece.

In a stunning 125-118 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers, Ferry wasn't just a contributor; he was a force of nature, erupting for a career-defining and franchise-altering 42 points. The forward’s performance was a symphony of efficiency and power, leaving the visiting team grasping at shadows all night.

While the 76ers boasted a valiant 30-point effort from their own star, the night belonged to one man. Ferry’s remarkable output, a figure that towers in the annals of Cavaliers history, was the relentless engine of Cleveland’s offense. Every crucial possession, every momentum-swinging basket seemed to flow through him. His scoring barrage was both methodical and explosive, a combination that Philadelphia simply had no answer for.

The Cavaliers, fueled by Ferry’s historic outburst, managed to withstand every push from a competitive 76ers squad. The game was a shootout, but Cleveland possessed the nuclear option. Alongside Ferry’s heroics, a strong double-double of 20 points and 15 rebounds provided the necessary interior balance, ensuring the offense was not one-dimensional.

In the end, the final box score told a simple story: Danny Ferry had ascended to a plane few players ever reach for a single night. His 42 points were not just a personal triumph but the definitive reason the Cavaliers emerged victorious. It was a performance for the ages, a night Cleveland would not soon forget, and a stunning individual achievement that secured a hard-fought win for the home team.
